intro: Silene noctiflora, commonly known as night-flowering catchfly, is a species of flowering plant in the Caryophyllaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky and calcareous soils. The plant is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Silene noctiflora is a short-lived perennial, typically growing to a height of 10–30 cm.
